name: ResourceDescription

contact.name: Visit the Github repository for more information

description:
ResourceDescription represents the shared characteristics common to both abstract and resource version descriptions. ResourceDescription is an abstract type and, as such, cannot be directly
				created. Resource descriptions are Changeable, meaning that they have identity and can be created, updated and deleted.

element.definition:
ResourceDescription represents the shared characteristics common to both abstract and resource version descriptions. ResourceDescription is an abstract type and, as such, cannot be directly
				created. Resource descriptions are Changeable, meaning that they have identity and can be created, updated and deleted.

element.name: about
element.short: the (or a) definitive URI that represents the resource being described
element.definition:
the (or a) definitive URI that represents the resource being described. Note that this is NOT the URI of the resource description in the CTS2 format, but of the resource itself. As an example, the
								about URI for the Wine ontology would be "http://www.w3.org/TR/2003/PR-owl-guide-20031209/wine#". The NCI Thesaurus has, amongst others, the
								about URI of http://ncicb.nci.nih.gov/xml/owl/EVS/Thesaurus.owl#. HL7 uses ISO Object Identifiers (OIDs) to label resources so, from the HL7 perspective, the about URI of the NCI Thesaurus would
							be "urn:oid:2.16.840.1.113883.3.26.1.1"

element.name: formalName
element.short: the formal or officially assigned name of this resource, if any
element.definition: the formal or officially assigned name of this resource, if any

element.name: keyword
element.short: additional identifiers that are used to index and locatethe resource
element.definition: additional identifiers that are used to index and locatethe resource

element.name: resourceType
element.short: the class(es) that this resource instantiates
element.definition: the class(es) that this resource instantiates

element.name: resourceSynopsis
element.short: a textual summary of the resource - what it is, what it is for, etc
element.definition: a textual summary of the resource - what it is, what it is for, etc.

element.name: additionalDocumentation
element.short: a reference to a document thatprovide additional information about the resource
element.definition: a reference to a document thatprovide additional information about the resource

element.name: sourceAndRole
element.short:
a reference to an individual, organization of bibliographic reference that participated in the creation, validation, review, dissemination of this resource and therole(s) they
								played
element.definition:
a reference to an individual, organization of bibliographic reference that participated in the creation, validation, review, dissemination of this resource and therole(s) they
								played

element.name: rights
element.definition: copyright and IP information. Note that rights applies to the source resource, not the CTS2 rendering.

element.name: note
element.short: an additional note or comment about the resource
element.definition: an additional note or comment about the resource

element.name: property
element.short: additional information about the resource that doesnot fit into any of the attributes described above
element.definition: additional information about the resource that doesnot fit into any of the attributes described above

element.name: alternateID
element.short: an alternative identifier that uniquely names this resource in other environments as contexts
element.definition:
an alternative identifier that uniquely names this resource in other environments as contexts. As an example, if a resource had both an ISO Object Identifier and a DNS name, the DNS name might
								be assigned as the entryID of the resource by one service while the ISO OID would be recorded as an alternateURI using the "urn:oid" prefix. Note that alternateIds can be added or removed
								during resource updates.

element.name: sourceStatements
element.short: a DirectoryURI that references the set of statements that were used to construct the containing resource
element.definition:
a DirectoryURI that references the set of statements that were used to construct the containing resource. This attribute must (may?) be present if and only if the service supports the
									Statement profile
